content.rendered:
Our Story

Pinky Promise aims to transform women's healthcare in India and make it judgment-free and accessible. We believe that technology can play a large, enabling role in helping women around the world to access scientific and instant reproductive healthcare.​​

Our founding team has more than 24 years of experience in healthcare collectively and together, we have worked to create the Pinky Promise app featuring a chatbot that walks a user from a symptom - be it painful periods, fertility problems, abnormal discharge etc. - all the way to an answer for that symptom. The chatbot was built using the best global clinical protocols and research from highly rated medical journals.​

Our app also has chatrooms where women can connect anonymously with thousands of women on issues like pregnancy, periods, fertility etc. Finally, we sell wellness products that cater to functional needs of women and make them feel empowered.​​

More importantly, we built Pinky Promise because we “get it”. As women who have grown up experiencing this, we understand how traumatising it could be to sit in a queue waiting for an abdominal scan, or to experience irregular periods, or be worried about one’s vaginal discharge. This is why we built an incredibly judgement-free and reassuring platform to give you the care that you deserve!​​

Meet our team

Divya Kamerkar

CEO and Co-Founder
• Life science and global health from Yale University
• MBA, Wharton School, University of Pennsylvania
• 6+ years experience advising several national and state governments on gender health strategy
• Worked as a gender specialist for Delhi Government, undertook police and healthcare reforms
• Published author in high-impact medical journals, work highlighted by the UN.

Adv. Rahul Kamerkar

Co-Founder
• Advocate practicing in the High Court of Bombay and Supreme Court of India.
• Has represented several Fortune 500 companies, HNIs, largest labour unions in the country, politicians, political parties, social activists, and victims.
• Specialises in matters concerning insolvency and bankruptcy, labour and employment, economic offences, and company law.

Dr. Reema Shah

MBBS, OB-GYN, Clinical Lead
• Founder – IRACAIM Women’s Well-being Centre.
• Specialises in concerns of Hormonal Imbalance, Menstrual Irregularities & PCOS.
• Over 7 years of work experience at various hospitals all over Mumbai including Jaslok Hospital, SRCC Hospital, Hinduja healthcare (Khar), Wadia Maternity and RN Cooper.

Dr. Pooja Jain

MBBS, DGO, DNB
• Dr. Pooja has over 8 years of experience as a gynaecologist in some of India’s premier medical institutions like Jaslok Hospital, MGM Hospital and NWMH Parel.

Dr. Akula Ramya Krishna

MBBS, DNB (Ob-Gyn)
• Dr. Ramya has over 9 years of experience as a gynaecologist in institutions like MNR Medical and Hospital, Rajiv Gandhi Government Women and Children Hospital, Dr. L H Hiranandani Hospital, R K Women`s Clinic, Sant Muktabai General Hospital and so on.

Anam Sajan

Marketing and
Support Associate

Jinal Sangani

Research and
Development Associate

Kirti Gaggar

Product Management
and Content Associate

Taybah Dayala

Human Resource and
Operations Associate

Awards & Recognition

Awards

Pinky Promise is the Global Winner of the FtxSDG competition conducted in partnership with Seedstars, where more than 4500 start-ups participated internationally.

The Jacobs Impact Entrepreneur Prize is given to those entrepreneurs who not only pursue high-impact start-ups at Wharton but are also able to grow their projects to a high scale in a short period of time.

Penn Wharton Innovation Fund’s grants are awarded to entrepreneurs within the Penn ecosystem who are able to grow and implement their start-up ideas

Weiss Tech House is a student-run incubation center. Pinky Promise won a seed grant for traction achieved in a short while!

Recognition

Pinky Promise Private Limited: This enterprise plans to eliminate cost, quality, and social barriers to sexual and reproductive health through technology, via a mobile app that provides an instant symptom assessment, doctor's consultation, testing, and community support chat rooms.
